Articles.Content:
It's been two weeks, so here's the update. Nearly there.

Awesome!

It's been two weeks, so here's the update. Nearly there.

Wow, I expected it to take much longer. Really looking forward to the re-release for 1.02! I cannot play without. Thx for the update and the teaserpics

I purchased through steam and it's already gone 1.0 > 1.01 > 1.02. I was under the impression Steam only allowed you to roll back to the previous?

Squad decides which version to put on "previous" each time they update. I haven't looked because I had a local copy of 0.90, but from the trouble that people are going to to get copies of the 1.0.0 aero tunings, I think Steam "previous" is still 0.90.
Quick question, does it mean that a version of kerbol 6.4x would be possible at this point?
Can't wait!! Nice!

Quick question, does it mean that a version of kerbol 6.4x would be possible at this point?

Any config pack that depended on the old RSS plugin will need to be ported to Kopernicus (and KSCSwitcher if it was using that feature of RSS). There's been some work done on Kopernicus-powered 6.4x configs, but nothing has made it to full release yet.
Nearly there.

Wait! You have to wait until my Linux laptop arrives and I get 64-bit KSP running!

(kidding! kidding! please nobody here kill me!)

Hey, i've made quick comparision between Google Earth and 8k Mars resolution in RSS. It's exactly the same place, Tithonium Chasma and it looks the same!

Just want to say thanks, Nathan Kell, I truly appreciate your work

Edited May 12, 2015 by winged
Is there a dev build somewhere for 1.0?

Is there a dev build somewhere for 1.0?

https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealSolarSystem this seems like it's the most up to date. Also it seems to only have Earth and Moon by quickly glancing at the Kopernicus config.

https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealSolarSystem this seems like it's the most up to date. Also it seems to only have Earth and Moon by quickly glancing at the Kopernicus config.

I checked and yes, Earth and Moon.

In terms of development, how much can be carried over from the 0.90 version of RSS?

Hey, i've made quick comparision between Google Earth and 8k Mars resolution in RSS. It's exactly the same place, Tithonium Chasma and it looks the same!

Simply amazing... ::bows before Nathan::

If man can't go to Mars, at least my kerbals can.

In terms of development, how much can be carried over from the 0.90 version of RSS?
AFAIK, some. Things will obviously have to be tweaked, though.

If you want to play around, grab the distribution/GameData/Kopernicus folder from KSP-RO/Kopernicus/revertBranch and grab regex's KSCSwitcher and grab KSP-RO/RealSolarSystem

Thanks everyone.

If you want to play around, grab the distribution/GameData/Kopernicus folder from KSP-RO/Kopernicus/revertBranch and grab regex's KSCSwitcher and grab KSP-RO/RealSolarSystem

Thanks everyone.

If I do this, will it break everything in my long-term career when I upgrade to the 'release' version of RSS?

If you want to play around, grab the distribution/GameData/Kopernicus folder from KSP-RO/Kopernicus/revertBranch and grab regex's KSCSwitcher and grab KSP-RO/RealSolarSystem

Thanks everyone.

Nathan, I am not sure whether you offer this for people to have fun with, or if you also are looking for beta/alpha-testers? If the latter, is there anything you are especially interested in?

Quick question, does it mean that a version of kerbol 6.4x would be possible at this point?

As undercoveryankee has mentioned, there has been some work. I've done some preliminary work on getting 6.4x scale Kerbol system into Kopernicus. I've actually got all the orbits and sizes ported over (with the exception of Moho, which seems to have some bug I can't squash on my end). The PQS stuff is a tiny bit harder for me, so I'm waiting for Kopernicus to get a bit more hashed out before I try to break more things.

EDIT: Paul Kingtiger may be doing some work as well, but I've only seen him mention a 3.2x scale he'd been toying with.

If you want to play around, grab the distribution/GameData/Kopernicus folder from KSP-RO/Kopernicus/revertBranch and grab regex's KSCSwitcher and grab KSP-RO/RealSolarSystem

Thanks everyone.

And speaking of Kopernicus, is your RO/RSS branch going to end up in mainline Kopernicus? Or will there be an RSS version and a normal version of that? I'm assuming the former, but want to make sure before I try to get all fancy working with dev versions!

Krakenfour: I certainly would not suggest playing career mode on that, since for example there's not anything more than Earth and Moon there, and RP-0 isn't out yet and won't be for a while. It's more so people can play with something if they want, since all the work is public anyway.

Lilienthal: Mostly the former; it doesn't need testing right now so much as work. Volunteers are always gratefully accepted however. Both for that and for RO, as there's a ton of stuff that needs doing.

Raptor831: Yeah, all the fixes/additions I need to make to Kopernicus will end up in the mainline (assuming teknoman doesn't gasp in horror at 'em when he returns ) so they'll be available for all. Thomas is planning to release 7 soon, I think, as soon as we get the space center issue sorted. (Space centers don't work without KSCSwitcher when you change Kerbin...)

BTW I keep forgetting to PM you about Real Fuels. It's not out yet because I took the opportunity for a quite severe refactor...

@NathanKell.. If there is something I can do to speed up the process, let me know. You're putting an awful lot of work on your plate, so if you have something specific you think someone else can do, I'm available. Professional C++/C# programmer here, so I can do coding.
@NathanKell, So the 1.0 RSS will use Kopernicus? Does that mean more planets/moons? Major changes to the config?
The former...will come in time, yes. The latter, definitely. Totally rewritten.
Yeah, I'll throw my hat in the ring for an unpaid RSS internship. Happy to help anywhere I can.
Awesome! Please come by #RO on espernet (link in the RO OP if you want a webchat link) and I'll get you right to work.

If you have a beta version out, I'd like to start working on an expansion pack like I did with 0.90. Basically a long term plan of adding the entire Uranus/Neptune systems, with as many moons as possible. And TNOs, although only the big ones there.
